item.title: Two Point Museum DLC ‘Fantasy Finds’ announced
item.content:encoded:
Publisher SEGA and developer Two Point Studios have announced Two Point Museum downloadable content “Fantasy Finds.” It will launch on July 17.

Here is an overview of the content, via SEGA:

Two Point Museum will venture deep into the world of medieval fantasy with “Fantasy Finds,” its first downloadable content release.

“Fantasy Finds” offers museum curators a new exclusive fantasy expedition map to explore with an enormous treasure trove of 40 exhibits to discover, such as the Teanie Kettle, Novel Wardrobe and Flying Carpet. These magical artefacts aren’t just for show either, as they will provide positive blessings for guests when well maintained… but watch out, those who don’t look after these intriguing curios will find they curse guests instead!

To discover these new magical exhibits on your expeditions, you’ll need to hire Fantasy Experts from Barbarian, Wizard, Rogue or Bard classes, each of whom possess their own stats. Does your team have enough combined Strength and Dexterity to counter a dragon attack? Perhaps you need the right combination of Intelligence and Luck to overcome a Picked Lock shortcut. Whatever the obstacle, “Fantasy Finds” will challenge you to hire a varied party of fantasy experts with their own strengths and talents to ensure you successfully return home from expeditions with new magical exhibits.

That’s not all, as “Fantasy Finds” will also weave its fantasy magic throughout your museum with three new guest archetypes, 26 decorations and utility items, interactive displays, banners, wallpapers, floors and you’ll even see your expedition helicopter joining in the fun, thanks to a fresh paint job ensuring it fits the medieval fantasy mood. You can even buff your museum staff with Mythical Gear exhibits which can be equipped or put on display, providing bonuses such as protection on nearby exhibits or even job security to fend off being fired.

Two Point Museum is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam, and is coming to Switch 2 in 2025.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

DLC “Fantasy Finds” Announce Trailer

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/two-point-museum-dlc-fantasy-finds-announced

item.title: Chained Echoes DLC ‘Ashes of Elrant’ launches August 7
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • Switch
  • Xbox One

New land, monsters, music, and more.

Chained Echoes downloadable content “Ashes of Elrant” will launch on August 7, publisher Deck13 Spotlight and developer Umami Tiger announced.

Here is an overview of the downloadable content, via Deck13 Spotlight:

“Ashes of Elrant” offers more of what fans and media loved: A new land to explore, more than 40 new monsters and bosses, 15 new tracks by mastermind Eddie Marianukroh (and maybe once again an interesting spin by an external band. Remember the turtles? Well, well…), gorgeous pixel art and finally a fishing minigame. Which isn’t mini. Trust us.

The “Crimson Wings” are needed once more!

“Ashes of Elrant” takes players to a new land, away from Valandis. It is set right before the final fight of Chained Echoes so you can prepare yourself for meeting your beloved heroes once again. The Clan of the Crimson Wings has to answer a call for help from the land of Elrant. A land where nothing is as it seems.

Fans will learn more about the background story of Valandis and also get a deeper look at the characters and their motivations. And with the White Wolf also someone really, really special within the history of Valandis will join the cast.

Chained Echoes is available now for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and GOG.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/chained-echoes-dlc-ashes-of-elrant-launches-august-7

item.title: Anger Foot coming to PS5 on July 1
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Kicking down the door to console.

Publisher Devolver Digital and developer Free Lives will release fast-paced first-person action game Anger Foot for PlayStation 5 on July 1, the companies announced.

Anger Foot first launched or PC via Steam on July 11, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via Devolver Digital:

About

Anger Foot is a lightning-fast hard bass blast of kicking doors and kicking ass. Crash through the caffeine-fueled fever dream of Shit City, putting the boot to a menacing menagerie of merciless gangsters.

Unleash the world’s deadliest feet on a colorful cast of anthropomorphic enemies. Clearing out slums, sewers, and skyscrapers as you grab new weapons, unlock new sneakers, and upgrade your powers in absurd and wonderful ways. Kick and shoot your way to the exit as you leave behind a smoldering trail of shattered doors, broken bones, and crumpled energy drinks.

Key Features

  • Fast-Paced Ass Kicking Action – Shit City is a disease and your foot is the cure. Lace-up a capricious collection of formidable footwear to fight through a diverse series of deranged city districts.
  • Vibrant Visuals, Relentless Beats – Enjoy a concussive, bass-thumping soundtrack as you stampede through a feverish criminal underworld. An assault on all your senses. Including common sense.
  • Run. Kick. Repeat. – Are you the god of style, speed, or power? Discover secrets and unlocks that encourage replayability—and learn to tackle levels in new creative, ridiculous, and devastating ways.
  • Master The Foot – Become one with the toes and be quick on the trigger. Your skills must surpass human comprehension if you are to prevail and learn the secret of the Anger Foot.

Watch a teaser video below.

PlayStation 5 Announce Teaser



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/anger-foot-coming-to-ps5-on-july-1

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 6/16/25 – 6/22/25
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

RAIDOU Remastered debuts at 51,435 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for week of June 9, 2025 to June 26, 2025.

Mario Kart World for Switch 2 remained the top seller for the third week since its launch, moving an additional 122,578 retail copies.

RAIDOU Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army was the highest selling new release of the week, opening at 21,146 units sold for Switch, 19,248 units for PlayStation 5, 5,783 units for Switch 2, and 5,258 units for PlayStation 4, for an opening week total of 51,435 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 140,026 units, the Switch family sold 12,769 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 6,006 units, the Xbox Series family sold 191 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 28 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [SW2] Mario Kart World (Nintendo, 06/05/25) – 122,578 (1,000,044)
  2. [NSW] RAIDOU Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army (ATLUS, 06/19/25) – 21,146 (New)
  3. [PS5] RAIDOU Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army (ATLUS, 06/19/25) – 19,248 (New)
  4. [NSW] FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time (LEVEL-5, 05/21/25) – 7,504 (130,625)
  5. [SW2] The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Nintendo, 06/05/25) – 5,887 (17,825)
  6. [SW2] RAIDOU Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army (ATLUS, 06/19/25) – 5,783 (New)
  7. [NSW] Mario Kart 8 Deluxe (Nintendo, 04/28/17) – 5,397 (6,353,250)
  8. [NSW] Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma (Marvelous, 06/05/25) – 5,339 (60,766)

  10. [SW2] The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Nintendo, 06/05/25) – 4,861 (17,261)
